Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: langais
Reviews.Content: The price is excellent, the rooms arent bad, and the staff is nice. If youre looking for a cheap,clean place to stay, this is it. Doesnt have the best location, and its kind of hard to find if your not familar with baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Every one was polite, rooms was pretty clean, can us some updating. Needs microwaves in rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Angela B
Reviews.Content: Rooms were clean, 6 floor rooms were larger than rooms on 4th floor. Every one was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Yolanda S
Reviews.Content: We had a family reunion at this hotel on 10/1/11 and was very satisfied. The Banquet Manager was very accomadating as was the entire staff. The staff was very polite. Though the hotel is is being upgraded and having exterior touch ups the rooms were satisfying. Our banquet room was just right for our event and again the banquet houseman and entire staff were very accomadating. I will definently book again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Shabby”
Reviews.Author: Polla9920
Reviews.Content: We went to the Baltimore Zoo and used GPS to find this hotel. I must say was alittle scary with the sketchy area, but to my surprise location of the hotel wasn't bad at all. We had requested a King bed / no smoking. They were very friendly at the front desk.... but the room we received stunk of smoke and blunts... no fridge and the phone didn't even operate to contact the front desk. So as one can imagine I was very unhappy. However, I used my cell phone called and it was resolved in less then 5 minutes. Then I was provided a very nice room with all the amenities promised as advertised and manager was very friendly and cooperative. Other, then that room was clean, staff was very friendly, and hotel was located very short commute into the city. I might not stay her again mainly because I want to be closer to the harbor, however you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “It was under construction!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lorraine10pr
Reviews.Content: I get there after reading a lot of good reviews and the price. It could be a better stay, but the hotel facilities were not good, the internet service never worked, the toilet was not working properly, to mention some. In addition, this place was under re-modeling. The room cleaning service was terrible too, they just pick towels and replace with new ones. You can see spider traps in all the room corners. The TV remote control didn´t work also. I have been in several hotels of the same class, with way better service and facilities than this one. Front desk service, very bad also. I have to say that this was my first and last stay over there.

Reviews.Title: “Going, going, gone down hill!”
Reviews.Author: khloe35
Reviews.Content: This hotel used to be a clean, quality, budget friendly hotel, now its a run down dump. had to move to 3 different rooms for a plugged, dirty sink to the sheets being soiled and hairy! ironically the staff didn't seem alarmed at all just shift you to another nasty room! WARNING STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and service.”
Reviews.Author: kdr31859
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a room that was close enough to the Balti. Convention Ctr. and cost effective, when this was located online. The room was clean had good; beds, TV, shower, heat and a decent continental breakfast. The price was right and it took less than 15 min. to get downtown. I was greatly impressed, when I realized I'd left something in the room and called 2 weeks later. The manager; Pat Patel returned my call and 3 days later I received my lost item, in the mail. I'd stay there again and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not Too Bad”
Reviews.Author: Mointe
Reviews.Content: The floor in the bathroom was sticky, the shower curtain had weird spots on it and the top of the TV looked liked someone had left a caramel apple on it and the service never cleaned it. Otherwise the roomrate for this room was higher than expected, they did not have any king beds available so I had to take a quenn at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: ToastMonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value for the money, but it leaves a lot to be desired. The bad: The manager at the desk chain-smokes outside of the front door which made the lobby reek of smoke when we arrived. There was a stale smoke smell even on our non-smoking floor, something I haven't experienced in a hotel in many years. There is no counter in the bathroom so there is no place to put "stuff", which seems silly but is an inconvenience nonetheless. Housecleaning employees were very loud in the morning with music and what sounded like wireless radios. Granted, we were sleeping late, but in a hotel I usually expect that employees would be respectful of guests who came to do exactly that: sleep. The room generally seemed sloppily finished and maintained. Nothing is especially comfortable; it's just a place to stay. The good: Obviously, the price. Free wireless internet and a nice sized mini-fridge. Free parking. The location felt safe when a lot of Baltimore did not. Also it's conveniently located to the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good accomodations, location and price.”
Reviews.Author: aisha423
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least 6-7 times. It is my first choice of hotel when I travel to Baltimore. Hotel is conveniently located near the interstate and downtown inner harbor. There is a large supermarket, a small shopping center and several fast food restaurants located one minute from this hotel. I stopped staying in the pricey downtown hotels because this hotel is "better" and much less expensive. The continential breakfast is so-so but there is free parking and smoking rooms are available. Caution, book early as this is a popular hotel and rooms sometimes sell out quickly. This is "my" hotel wheneven I travel to Baltimore. I have recommended this hotel to many friends and family members.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: limeypd
Reviews.Content: For the price, I was a little nervous that it would be a dump. It was not. It was clean, quiet and comfortable. Was it new luxury accomodation? - no, of course not. But the beds were comfortable, there was free wi-fi and the free breakfast was ok, even if it was carbs only. Great value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Try running a vacuum..”
Reviews.Author: silic0nsilence
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because it was cheap and had good reviews on TripAdvisor. As I walk in, the lobby is beautiful. The man who checks me in has the worst attitude in the world.. So far, OK. I get to my room and it seems nice. A mini-fridge, enough towels etc. But when I took off my shoes and started walking on the carpet my socks turned black. There were sunflower seeds on the floor (Explain that one) amongst other wrappers and dirt. It looked like it hadn't been vacuumed in months. The shower was disgusting and I actually had to take out the metal water stopper because it was broke. The top of the TV was sticky and had several rings on it that looked like they were caused by beer bottles. If someone had put some effort into cleaning this room, it wouldn't have been so bad. For the price, it was a good deal. But I expect a clean room. Everyone should expect a clean room. I would've forked up an extra $40 and stayed at a better hotel if I could've.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: bishop10021
Reviews.Content: Solid no frills hotel. rooms were clean and the staff was very helpful. Good choice for the money. You must book in the advance on weekends because they tend to fill up quickly.

Reviews.Title: “The worst”
Reviews.Author: noway123
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked in i knew we made a terrible decision. There were all these people hanging out in the doorway. The front staff could careless about your happiness or their own it seemed The room --well more the bathroom was so dirty--the only good thing is that we only stayed there one night There were also some shady characters in the elevators--I am not sure where these people advertise PLEASE STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean & comfortable”
Reviews.Author: rabbitsrus
Reviews.Content: This was above average, clean rooms comfortable bed. When I got in the room there were a few blown light bulbs, I called to the front desk and there was someone there within 10min to replace and bring extra towels for us. I did see they had continental breakfast but we had plans with family for breakfast. Lobby area was nice & clean, We never heard any noise from any other rooms. Ample parking and close to town. I booked a non smoking room and it was non smoking. Much better experience here than at the Days Inn we were at last year. $75/night was great price. I would stay here again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel the night before taking a cruise from the Port of Baltimore. The room was very noisy. People were in and out of the adjoining room all night long. Kids were running the halls all night long and slamming doors. Was the worst experience staying in a hotel I've ever had. Will never stay there again and will not recommend it to anybody. I felt afraid to go out of the room once we were in. It is located in a bad section of town, and had trouble finding it in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Inn is the Best Deal in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I were looking forward to going to Baltimore on a Saturday to see a baseball game at Camden Yards. We got the tickets but realized later it was the Preakness weekend, meaning the hotels in the Inner Harbor were $350 and up. I'm telling you, for $77 with tax, you can't beat this place. Especially if you're just sleeping in your room. The area is not great by any means, but if you can block out your surroundings, the Best in is the Best Deal around. It is close to the highway, the people were friendly, a chirping smoke detector was fixed immediately, the room was clean, it had a fridge, and the beds were brand new pillowtop mattresses (and comfortable). I would highly recommend the Best Inn for a bunch of guys who don't need anything fancy, just a decent place to crash. Seems like anything goes there too, which is what this country is all about.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Bergs43
Reviews.Content: After researching for days and nearly fainting at the prices of hotels in the Harbor area we decided to stay at the Best Inn on February 19, 2005. We weren't expecting much, we just wanted a clean, reasonably priced hotel to sleep in after a long day at the Harbor. That's exactly what we got. This hotel is NOT fancy, the continental breakfast is...well, not... but our room was clean, it smelled very fresh, had a small fridge, and it was quiet up on the 5th floor. I think this hotel is a lot nicer than the ones down at the harbor (from what I've read about some of them anyway!) and it wasn't hard to find our way to the downtown area. I'm sure we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: jimmyk64
Reviews.Content: This small property has become our lodging of choice in greater Baltimore after staying at a few of the upscale downtown hotels. We've always been treated graciously by the entire staff. We've returned here six times by most recent count. The rooms are spacious and CLEAN. Coffee makers, hair dryers and irons join the newly added mini-refrigerators(not stocked, only a convenience)as amenities in each room. The price can't be beat for a family on vacation. Ask at the desk for directions to Brookey's, a small farm kitchen restaurant with a great dinner menu and terrific bar service

HotelInfo.Name: Americas Best Value Inn
HotelInfo.Address: 6510 Frankford Avenue, Baltimore, MD 21206
